qas.question: The function of the brain from an evolutionary-biological thought is what?

answers.text: provide coherent control over the actions of an animal

context: From an evolutionary-biological perspective, the function of the brain is to <a0_0>provide coherent control over the actions of an animal<a0_0/>. A centralized brain allows groups of muscles to be co-activated in complex patterns; it also allows stimuli impinging on one part of the body to evoke responses in other parts, and it can prevent different parts of the body from acting at cross-purposes to each other.
